thread.title: NFL commits to London with 2020 vision
thread.title_full: NFL commits to London with 2020 vision

title: NFL commits to London with 2020 vision
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now NFL commits to London with 2020 vision Jacksonville Jaguars have been playing NFL matches at Wembley since 2013 Andrew Matthews/PA:Press Association Alyson Rudd Published at 12:01AM, October 23 2015 
American football will be a London attraction until at least 2020 after the NFL agreed to play at least two games a year at Wembley. This will be in addition to the two games that will be hosted by the rebuilt White Hart Lane scheduled to open in 2018. 
This weekend the one millionth fan of the London version of the game will pass through the Wembley turnstiles as the Buffalo Bills face the Jacksonville Jaguars, who will continue to play a home game at the stadium for the next five years. 
Shahid Khan, the billionaire owner of Fulham and Subscribe now
